data.title: Orhan Pamuk Winner of the 2005 Nobel Prize in Literature
data.meta_description: Orhan Pamuk, a Nobel Prize Laureate in Literature, at the Nobel Prize Internet Archive.
data.text:
2006 Nobel Laureate in Literature

who in the quest for the melancholic soul of his native city has discovered new symbols for the clash and interlacing of cultures

Background

Born: June 7, 1952

Place of birth: Istanbul, Turkey

Biographical highlights:

Graduates from Robert College

Studies architecture at Istanbul Technical University

Studies journalism at Institute of Journalism at the Istanbul University

1982 - Marries Aylin Turegen

1982 - Publishes first novel, Cevdet Bey ve Ogullan

1983 - Wins Orhan Kemal Novel Prize for Cevdet Bey

1984 - Wins Madarali Novel Prize for Sessiz Ev

1985-8 - Visiting researcher at Columbia University and University of Iowa

1990 - Wins the Independent Award for Foreign Fiction

1995 - Wins Prix France Culture

2001 - Divorces Aylin Turegen

2002 - Wins Prix du Meilleur Livre Etranger

2003 - Wins the IMPAC Dublin Award

2005 - Wins Le Prix Medicis for Snow

2005 - Placed on trial for public denigration of Turkey's national character"

2006 - Turkish court drops charges of "insulting Turkishness"

2006 - Wins Le Prix Mediterranee etranger for his novel Snow
